results.title: Crush
results.creator_credit: Bridget Ikin, Hibiscus Films and Alison MacLean
results.brief_description: Alison Maclean’s (“Kitchen sink”, “Jesus’ son”) debut feature is a macabre psychological study of obsession, sexual jealousy and female friendships. Marcia Gay Harden stars as the brazen and destructive Lane, a classic femme fatale archetype who finds herself stuck in the sleepy New Zealand town of Rotorua after she and her girlfriend Christina (Donogh Rees) are involved in a near fatal car accident. Lane walks away from the crash site unharmed, leaving her friend for dead and lands on the doorstep of the shy and tomboyish Angela (Caitlin Bossley) and her novelist father Colin (William Zappa). The awkward teen soon develops a crush on the more sexually confident Lane, who in turn makes a play for Angela’s father, leaving the abandoned girl devastated and thirsty for revenge. Maclean uses the shifting power plays as an astute metaphor for New Zealand’s own confused relationship to cultural identity, shrewdly casting an American as the self assured and opportunistic outsider, while setting the film in the mainly Maori community of Rotorua. Cast also includes Peter Smith and Jon Brazier.

results.title: Crusades: 1095-1291
results.brief_description: Discusses the social, economic and religious climate that gave birth and then momentum to the Crusades and treats the various Crusades from a human viewpoint.

results.title: Crusade
results.creator_credit: Frank Donovan Associates, American Cancer Society and Frank Donovan
results.brief_description: Describes the three-fold program of the American Cancer Society: depicts the volunteer effort to save lives through education and to give help to the cancer patient in service; and discusses the hope for the future of the national research program. Narrated by Spencer Tracy.

results.title: Crucifixion: theme and variations
results.creator_credit: Filmmakers, George Jacobson, Mavis Lyons and J.H. Lenauer
results.brief_description: Interpretation by three Flemish artists, of the theme of the Crucifixion from the original paintings in the Johnson Collection at the Philadelphia Museum of Art. The following are studied: “Christ carrying the Cross” by the Master of the Turin Adoration (1490-1510); “Christ on the Cross and the Virgin and St. John” by Roger van der Weyden (1399-1464); and “Pieta” by Gerard David (1460-1523). Commentary by Murvyn Vye.

results.title: Crows and sparrows = Wuya yu maque [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Kunlun Film Company and Zheng Junli
results.brief_description: Production of this landmark film began in 1948 but was halted by the Kuomintang authorities when they discovered that the submitted script was not being followed and was heavily anti-KMT. In the interval before it resumed production in September 1949, it was rewritten to be even more hostile to KMT authorities. The film centres on the joys and disasters experienced by the inhabitants of a boarding house comandeered by a KMT official. The film’s basic form is derived from the modern drama tradition of China. The casual naturalism has been compared with neo-realism. Cast includes Zhao Dan, Wu Yin ans Sun Daolin. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Crown of righteousness
results.creator_credit: Ray Hoke, GHW Production and Norman Walker
results.brief_description: Paul’s captivity in Rome. Ephroditus bring him gifts from the Church in Phillippi. A reconstruction of the events relation to St Paul’s re-arrest and hie trial before Nero (2 Timothy IV 7-8).

results.title: Crow boy (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: A shy boy attending a village school in Japan withdraws into a world of his own until a kind and wise teacher draws him out and his classmates discover his special talent. Based on the book of the same title by Taro Yashima.

results.title: Crossroads. Eight miles high
results.creator_credit: High Thomson, Mick Conefrey, Alan Lewens, Karen Walsh, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dancing in the street: a rock and roll history”.
The Blues crosses the Atlantic and reaches Britain where it finds a new direction. Groups like the Beatles and the Rolling Stones invade America and somewhere in the process Heavy Metal is invented. In this episode entitled ‘Crossroads’, interviews and performances by legendary musicians such as The Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, Jeff Beck are featured. In the second program ‘Eight miles high’ the whole phenomenon of Psychadelia is explored, including interviews and clips from The Grateful Dead, Janis Joplin and Pink Floyd. This episode captures a landmark era in the development of rock music in the 1960’s.
